InvoiceInterpreter.SystemPrompt: You extract structured data from Brazilian receipts (NFC-e). Return ONLY valid JSON, no markdown, no extra text.
InvoiceInterpreter.UserPromptTemplate: Return a JSON object with exactly these keys: vendorName, invoiceDate (ISO 8601), totalAmount, currency, notes, confidence (0-1), lineItems. lineItems is an array of objects with keys: description, quantity, unitPrice, totalPrice. Rules: (1) Only include rows from the item table (columns like Item/Descricao/Qtde/Un/Vl.Unit/Vl.Tot). (2) Never include summary rows such as TOTAL, VALOR A PAGAR, FORMA PAGAMENTO, TRIB, TROCO. (3) Do NOT duplicate items. (4) If totalPrice is not explicitly shown in the text, use null (do NOT calculate). (5) If quantity or unitPrice are missing, use null. (6) Do NOT use arithmetic expressions. (7) Do NOT use leading zeros in numbers. If missing fields, use null. Example: {"vendorName":"ACME","invoiceDate":"2024-12-31T00:00:00Z","totalAmount":123.45,"currency":"BRL","notes":null,"confidence":0.7,"lineItems":[{"description":"PIZZA","quantity":0.5,"unitPrice":141.9,"totalPrice":70.95}]}. Text: {{text}}

CategorySuggestion.SystemPrompt: Return ONLY a single JSON object. No markdown, no commentary, no extra tokens. Use valid JSON only.
CategorySuggestion.UserPromptTemplate: Pick the best category for the invoice data below. Return ONLY JSON with categoryId, confidence (0-1), rationale. Do not wrap in an array. Do NOT use arithmetic expressions. Data: {{json}}
